content.text:
# Draft:Mexicans Invasions of 1842

The Mexican invasions of 1842, also known as Mexican attempts to reconquer Texas were a series of invasions in the mid-nineteenth century by generals in the service of Mexico against the newly independent Republic of Texas with the purpose of recovering it. Texas
| commander1        = First invasion Mariano Arista Ráfael Vásquez Ramon ValeraSecond invasion Antonio CanalesThird invasion Adrián Woll Cayetano Montero Pedro Rangel José Carrasco
| result            = Texan victory
| commander2        = First invasion John C. Hays Manuel N. Flores Juan SeguínSecond invasion Ewen Cameron' James DavisThird invasion Mathew Caldwell John C. Hays Nicholas Mosby Dawson
| date              = 5 March 1842 - 11 September 1842
| strength1         = First invasion700 mens
| image             = File:Republic of Texas-Mexico border map.png
| image_size        = 300px
| caption           = Border map between Texas and Mexico in 1842
}}
